alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 12 at 4:00AM AKST until February 13 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 3 inches. West to southwest winds 15 to 30 mph with gusts as high as 40 mph. Reduced visibilities to one quarter mile. * WHERE...Homer. * WHEN...From noon today to midnight AKST tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility to one quarter mile or less at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Expect periods of light snow through tonight. Southwest winds will rapidly strengthen between 9 am and Noon on Sunday, then peak during the afternoon and early evening hours. With temperatures in the 20s, snow will easily be lofted and immediately result in low visibilities. Conditions will gradually improve late this evening into the overnight hours as winds diminish.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
